snippet: The Olympic Committee opened the door for host cities to export some events to distant locations, which could affect the unifying quality of the Games.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column holds that International Olympic Committee has opened door to incredible possibilities by allowing potential host cities to share bids with other cities; notes reform is creating talk that Pyeongchang, South Korea, awarded 2018 Winter Games, will not host every Winter Olympics event and will send sliding events anywhere that already has facilities for those sports.
lead_paragraph: The Olympic Committee opened the door for host cities to export some events to distant locations, which could affect the unifying quality of the Games.

headline.main: Hosting the Games, Just Not All of Them
headline.print_headline: Hosting the Games, Just Not All of Them
